p: The most important complication of influenza virus infection is pneumonia (primary viral or secondary bacterial pneumonia) [ 9]. While costs can be high, the precise burden remains a blind spot [ 10â€“ 15]. Such burden information is crucial for prevention and response considering that vaccination, the main control measure against influenza infection, is aimed at preventing complications. A severe influenza season may also lead to hospital capacity problems, especially in ICUs. In this study we analyze comprehensive retrospective ICU data to fill the current knowledge gap.
